title: Vector Representation
text: A vector is represented by each of its components, which are denoted by $$x_1$$, $$x_2$$, $$x_3$$, and $$x_4$$.

title: Standard Basis Vectors
text: The first standard basis vector $$e_1$$ has a $$1$$ in the first component, and zeroes in all other components. The place of the $$1$$ corresponds to what number basis vector.

title: Recognizing Basis Vectors
text: What is the fourth standard basis vector in $$R^4$$?

title: Negative Basis Vectors
text: The negation of a vector can be found by multiplying all of the components by $$-1$$.

title: Evaluating the Function
text: To evaluate the function, plug in the components of the standard basis vectors that correspond to $$x_1$$ to $$x_4$$.

title: Domain and Range
text: The f: R**4→R specifies that there are $$4$$ values for the input for each of the $$4$$ dimensions, and the return value should be one dimensional, or a single number.
